intro: Boerhavia verticillata var. fallacissimus, commonly known as false nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and usually pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
